com.lonepulse.robozombie.processor
Class ProcessorChainLink<RESULT,FAILURE extends Throwable>

java.lang.Object
  com.lonepulse.robozombie.processor.ProcessorChainLink<RESULT,FAILURE>

public final class ProcessorChainLink<RESULT,FAILURE extends Throwable>
extends Object

Represents a single link in a processor chain. It wraps the Processor to be executed and accepts another ProcessorChainLink as its successor. All implementations are expected to check for the availability of a successor and invoke it with the results of the current link's execution and return the successive results.

Since:
1.3.0

Version:
1.1.0

Author:
Lahiru Sahan Jayasinghe

Method Detail

from

public static <RESULT,FAILURE extends Throwable> ProcessorChainLink<RESULT,FAILURE> from(Processor<RESULT,FAILURE> processor)

Creates a new ProcessorChainLink and wraps the given Processor which handles the execution for this link in the chain.

Parameters:
processor - the Processor to be wrapped by this instance of ProcessorChainLink

Returns:
a new instance of ProcessorChainLink which wraps the provided Processor

Throws:
IllegalStateException - if the given Processor is null; a ProcessorChainLink must always enclose a Processor which is invoked when the execution reaches this link in a chain

Since:
1.3.0

setSuccessor

public ProcessorChainLink<RESULT,FAILURE> setSuccessor(ProcessorChainLink<RESULT,FAILURE> successor)

Assigns the given ProcessorChainLink as the designated successor to this link.

Once this link's Processor produces it result, it is to be fed to the successor and the successive result is the output of this link.

Parameters:
successor - the ProcessorChainLink to be designated as the successor to this link

Returns:
the same Processor which was provided as the successor

Since:
1.3.0

getSuccessor

public ProcessorChainLink<RESULT,FAILURE> getSuccessor()

Retrieves the ProcessorChainLink which is the designated successor to this link.

Returns:
the ProcessorChainLink designated as the successor to this link

Since:
1.3.0

isTerminalLink

public boolean isTerminalLink()

Checks whether this ProcessorChainLink is the last link in its chain and ensures that there are no more successors to traverse.

Returns:
true if this is indeed the terminal link

Since:
1.3.0

getProcessor

public Processor<RESULT,FAILURE> getProcessor()

Retrieves the Processor which is wrapped by this instance of ProcessorChainLink.

Returns:
the Processor which is wrapped by this instance of ProcessorChainLink

Since:
1.3.0
